repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Robert M. Vogel and Helena E. Wright Collection of Nashawena Mills Photographs
did.abstract: Photographs of Nashawena Mills, New Bedford, Massachusetts.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Incorporated in 1909, the Nashawena Mills was making fine cotton and silk goods and jacquard novelties in 1929, although it branched out into other goods later on. The mills appear to have gone out of business by 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interior and exterior views of Nashawena Mills, New Bedfort, Massachusetts. Included are images of the buildings, machinery, male and female workers, and male executives.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert M. Vogel and Helena E. Wright Collection of Nashawena Mills Photographs #6863 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6863: Robert M. Vogel and Helena E. Wright Collection of Textile Industry Records

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Robert M. Vogel and Helena E. Wright

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The ATHM # references the accession number given to collections by the American Textile History Museum. These numbers have been kept and tracked for researchers looking for former citations. For images, these numbers will also be the digital object identifier if the item was scanned.

did.unittitle: Personnel of the Nashawena Mills, ATHM# 1994.3.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image depicts the management personnel posed in front of what is presumably the Nashawena Mills building. Two rows of men in shirts and ties; the back row has 13 men standing, the front row has 9 seated. Written on the photo is "Personnel of the Nashawena Mills, New Bedford, Mass. John L. Burton, Agent, June, 27-1929" but it is unknown if Burton is in this photo or which one of the men might be him.

did.unittitle: Exterior view of the Nashawena Mills, ATHM# 1994.3.6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows exterior view of mills, with four-story brick building on the left, and a two-story building on the right; complex takes up most of a city block.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows posed group of female workers and two male overseers in the warping room; warping machinery on either side of group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows posed group of male workers and boys in front of the spooling machinery; two supervisors in the group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows interior view of slashing room with male workers posed in front of slashers.

did.unittitle: Employees of the Nashawena Mills, ATHM# 1994.3.10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows posed group of male and female (primarily female) employees in an interior room of the Nashawena Mills.

did.unittitle: Office of the Nashawena Mills, ATHM# 1994.3.11

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows male worker seated at desk and female worker standing in office of mill; calendar turned to March 1916.

did.unittitle: Spooling room with female employees, ATHM# 1994.3.12

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print. Image shows female workers standing beside machines; bins of spools are on the left.

did.unittitle: Spooling room with four employees, ATHM# 1994.3.13

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, ca. 1916. Image shows two female employees standing by machines and two male overseers in foreground of spooling room of Nashawena Mills.
